textBox.richText: End of the Tax Credit: What Will Happen Next?   There has been a lot of speculation in my industry about whether or not the market will be affected now that the first time buyer tax credit has expired.  According to a Rismedia study, consumer confidence remains high in the real estate market with over 65% of those polled saying the end of the credit will not affect their decision to buy a home.  Even more important, this study found that 46% of people felt the real estate values in their neighborhood would increase in the next year.  With the possibility of increasing mortgage rates and unemployment still looming, truly only time will tell.  However, I’ve found the start of summer to be tremendously busy time for my office with many new listing and new buyers entering the market at rates we haven’t seen in several years.   Forbes Magazine: Talking Trash About Denver? April 5th was a shocking day in the Denver real estate world.  Forbes Magazine published an unflattering report on the Denver real estate market only to be met with harsh criticism from a wide number of Denverites- from Mayor John Hickenlooper to the entire real estate community.  Essentially, the article relied extensively on information provided by Zillow which proved to be grossly inaccurate due to double counting in Zillow’s statistics of unsold homes.  As a result, Forbes has retracted their statement and said they will no longer rely on Zillow’s inventory data.  Take That! New Listing in Denver! $250,000, 4 bed, 1 bath, 2008 square feet Completely remodeled in 2005, this charming bungalow has lots to offer! The home is open and light with a modern granite-tiled kitchen and lovely renovated bathroom. Over 2,000 finished square feet make this home a rare find in City Park and the main living area is ideal for entertaining.  There are two fireplaces, one in the living room and one in the family room. The backyard is landscaped beautifully, and the home sits on a large 6,280 square foot lot with tons of gardening and outdoor entertaining space. The basement is fully finished and gorgeous. Everything is freshly painted and modernized.  Call Elizabeth for more information.
